title: Sofa maker Loaf bakes in growth plans as sales rise
text:
Trendy sofa start-up Loaf defied turmoil suffered by high street rivals to post a rise in sales last year.

The retailer, which targets younger shoppers with quirkily named sofas such as the Butterbump and the Smooch, reported a £6.7m rise in turnover to £48m for the year to the end of March.

Pre-tax profits were flat at £2.6m as it chose to invest in growth and opened more showrooms, Companies House accounts showed.

It launched sites in Wilmslow, Solihull, Bristol and St Albans last year, taking its total to eight.
